nvp.hpp

00001 #ifndef BOOST_SERIALIZATION_NVP_HPP
00002 #define BOOST_SERIALIZATION_NVP_HPP
00003 
00004 // MS compatible compilers support #pragma once
00005 #if defined(_MSC_VER) && (_MSC_VER >= 1020)
00006 # pragma once
00007 #endif
00008 
00010 // nvp.hpp: interface for serialization system.
00011

00018 
00019 #include <utility>
00020 
00021 #include <boost/config.hpp>
00022 #include <boost/detail/workaround.hpp>
00023 // supress noise
00024 #if BOOST_WORKAROUND(BOOST_MSVC, <= 1200)
00025 # pragma warning (disable : 4786) // too long name, harmless warning
00026 #endif
00027 
00028 #include <boost/mpl/integral_c.hpp>
00029 #include <boost/mpl/integral_c_tag.hpp>
00030 
00031 #include <boost/serialization/level.hpp>
00032 #include <boost/serialization/tracking.hpp>
00033 #include <boost/serialization/split_member.hpp>
00034 #include <boost/serialization/base_object.hpp>
00035 #include <boost/serialization/traits.hpp>
00036 #include <boost/serialization/wrapper.hpp>
00037 
00038 namespace boost {
00039 namespace serialization {
00040 
00041 template<class T>
00042 struct nvp : 
00043     public std::pair<const char *, T *>,
00044     public wrapper_traits<nvp<T> >
00045 {
00046     explicit nvp(const char * name, T & t) :
00047         // note: redundant cast works around borland issue
00048         std::pair<const char *, T *>(name, (T*)(& t))
00049     {}
00050     nvp(const nvp & rhs) : 
00051         // note: redundant cast works around borland issue
00052         std::pair<const char *, T *>(rhs.first, (T*)rhs.second)
00053     {}
00054 
00055     const char * name() const {
00056         return this->first;
00057     }
00058     T & value() const {
00059         return *(this->second);
00060     }
00061 
00062     const T & const_value() const {
00063         return *(this->second);
00064     }
00065 
00066     // True64 compiler complains with a warning about the use of
00067     // the name "Archive" hiding some higher level usage.  I'm sure this
00068     // is an error but I want to accomodated as it generates a long warning
00069     // listing and might be related to a lot of test failures.
00070     // default treatment for name-value pairs. The name is
00071     // just discarded and only the value is serialized. 
00072     template<class Archivex>
00073     void save(
00074         Archivex & ar, 
00075         const unsigned int /* file_version */
00076     ) const {
00077         // CodeWarrior 8.x can't seem to resolve the << op for a rhs of "const T *"
00078         ar.operator<<(const_value());
00079     }
00080     template<class Archivex>
00081     void load(
00082         Archivex & ar, 
00083         const unsigned int /* file_version */
00084     ){
00085         // CodeWarrior 8.x can't seem to resolve the >> op for a rhs of "const T *"
00086         ar.operator>>(value());
00087     }
00088     BOOST_SERIALIZATION_SPLIT_MEMBER()
00089 };
00090 
00091 template<class T>
00092 inline
00093 #ifndef BOOST_NO_FUNCTION_TEMPLATE_ORDERING
00094 const
00095 #endif
00096 nvp<T> make_nvp(const char * name, T & t){
00097     return nvp<T>(name, t);
00098 }
00099 
00100 // to maintain efficiency and portability, we want to assign
00101 // specific serialization traits to all instances of this wrappers.
00102 // we can't strait forward method below as it depends upon
00103 // Partial Template Specialization and doing so would mean that wrappers
00104 // wouldn't be treated the same on different platforms.  This would
00105 // break archive portability. Leave this here as reminder not to use it !!!
00106 #if 0 // #ifndef BOOST_NO_TEMPLATE_PARTIAL_SPECIALIZATION
00107 
00108 template <class T>
00109 struct implementation_level<nvp<T> >
00110 {
00111     typedef mpl::integral_c_tag tag;
00112     typedef mpl::int_<object_serializable> type;
00113     BOOST_STATIC_CONSTANT(int, value = implementation_level::type::value);
00114 };
00115 
00116 // nvp objects are generally created on the stack and are never tracked
00117 template<class T>
00118 struct tracking_level<nvp<T> >
00119 {
00120     typedef mpl::integral_c_tag tag;
00121     typedef mpl::int_<track_never> type;
00122     BOOST_STATIC_CONSTANT(int, value = tracking_level::type::value);
00123 };
00124 
00125 #endif
00126 
00127 } // seralization
00128 } // boost
00129 
00130 #include <boost/preprocessor/stringize.hpp>
00131 
00132 #define BOOST_SERIALIZATION_NVP(name)                              \
00133     boost::serialization::make_nvp(BOOST_PP_STRINGIZE(name), name)
00134 
00135 
00136 #define BOOST_SERIALIZATION_BASE_OBJECT_NVP(name)                  \
00137     boost::serialization::make_nvp(                                \
00138         BOOST_PP_STRINGIZE(name),                                  \
00139         boost::serialization::base_object<name >(*this)            \
00140     )
00141 
00142 
00143 #endif // BOOST_SERIALIZATION_NVP_HPP
